title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady nearly joined the Las Vegas Raiders as a quarterback in 2020, according to owner Mark Davis.
Brady became a minority owner of the Raiders in May 2023, after retiring from the NFL.
The NFL adjusted rules for Brady in 2025, allowing him to attend FOX production meetings but barring him from team facilities.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd is now available on HBO Max.
Spike Lee and Denzel Washington's 'Highest 2 Lowest' can be streamed on Apple TV+.
'Lilo & Stitch' live-action remake is currently streaming on Disney+.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Raiders, led by new head coach Pete Carroll, prepare to face the Patriots without Bill Belichick for the first time.
Jakobi Meyers expresses mixed emotions about playing his former team, the Patriots, as a Raider in Foxborough.
Patriots' strong front seven features key players like Milton Williams and Christian Barmore, posing a challenge for the Raiders.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown and YouTuber IShowSpeed livestreamed a tour around Boston, including a comedic reenactment of the Boston Tea Party.
Brown and IShowSpeed raced in Downtown Crossing with Brown contesting IShowSpeed's win after he reportedly pulled a hamstring.
Brown has increased his streaming presence, collaborating with Kyrie Irving and launching his own Twitch channel, FCHWPO.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell is set to make his NFL debut as the Patriots' starting left tackle on Sunday against the Raiders.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's motor, run blocking, and improved hand usage despite concerns about his arm length.
Campbell received high grades from Pro Football Focus in preseason, facing Raiders' Maxx Crosby in his first NFL game.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel responds to UNC's ban on Patriots scouts, emphasizing focus on their team and respecting UNC's decisions.
Bill Belichick, now UNC coach, prohibits Patriots scouts at practice, reflecting strained relationship with Patriots owner Robert Kraft.
Belichick's college coaching starts poorly as UNC loses 48-14 to TCU, marking a record defensive low in his coaching career.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A University of Rhode Island student is suing the school, alleging she was filmed in a dorm's unisex shower.
The lawsuit accuses URI of negligence and defamation, claiming lax bathroom security placed her in a vulnerable position.
The woman cited emotional distress and seeks URI actions to improve the security of all-gender dorm facilities.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots cornerback Christian Gonzalez will miss the season opener against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is listed as questionable with an ankle injury for the game versus the Raiders.
Raiders bring new head coach Pete Carroll and quarterback Geno Smith to face the Patriots' revamped secondary.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum is recovering well from an Achilles injury, according to Celtics teammate Jordan Walsh.
There is no set timetable for Tatum's return after his May injury during the Eastern Conference Semifinals.
Celtics face a challenging season with a reshuffled roster, amid Tatum's uncertain return date.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New Raiders head coach Pete Carroll reunites with quarterback Geno Smith, aiming to recreate past playoff success.
Las Vegas Raiders feature standout talents including tight end Brock Bowers and edge rusher Maxx Crosby.
Raiders' running back Ashton Jeanty, 2025 Offensive Rookie of the Year favorite, presents challenge to Patriots' run defense.
